title: Simple Linear Regression
contentHtml:
Simple linear regression is a fundamental concept in statistical modeling that helps us understand the relationship between two continuous variables.

We'll explore how to model this relationship using the least squares method and interpret the results, including understanding residuals.
name: Simple Linear Regression Model" },
intuition: In simple linear regression, we're trying to find a straight line that best predicts one variable (response) based on another variable (feature).
realWorldApplications: Predicting house prices based on number of bedrooms
Analyzing the relationship between stock prices and economic indicators
commonMistakes: Assuming a linear relationship exists when it doesn't
Ignoring residuals and not checking model assumptions

subject: statistics
title: Simple Linear Regression
subtitle: Modeling relationships between variables
contentHtml:
Simple linear regression is a fundamental concept in statistical modeling that helps us understand the relationship between two continuous variables.

We'll explore how to model this relationship, calculate least squares, and interpret the results. This concept is crucial for many applications, including machine learning and artificial intelligence.
intuition: Think of simple linear regression as drawing a straight line to best fit the data points. The goal is to find the line that minimizes the sum of squared errors.
visualDescription: A scatter plot with a fitted line would be helpful in visualizing this concept
commonMistakes: Failing to check assumptions for linear regression
realWorldApplications: Predicting house prices based on number of bedrooms and square footage (ML/AI application)

intuition: Think of a line that best fits your data points. Simple linear regression helps you find the slope and intercept of this line, which can reveal insights about the relationship between variables.
realWorldApplications: Predicting housing prices based on features like number of bedrooms
